context_of_use: This use case allows customers to place orders through checkout and track their order status.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: wants to manage their orders effectively.
description: This use case enables customers to checkout using multiple payment methods and track their order status.
preconditions: Customer has selected products to purchase.
Customer is logged into their account.
postconditions: Order is successfully placed and payment is processed.
Customer can view the status of their order.
assumptions: Customer has a valid payment method available.
requirements_met: The system shall allow customers to checkout using multiple payment methods.
The system shall allow customers to track their orders.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the types of payment methods supported.
main_flow: 1. Customer selects products to purchase → System displays the checkout page.
2. Customer chooses a payment method → System processes the payment.
3. Customer confirms the order → System confirms the order and provides an order summary.
4. Customer can track their order status → System displays the current status of the order.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the customer wants to browse products before checkout, they can select the 'Browse Products' option → System displays the product categories.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If payment processing fails, the system notifies the customer and prompts for a different payment method.
